parts: If I have a sole proprietorship in Singapore and I want to hire staff, what is the procedure and admin requirements? Include details like registering for the auto-inclusion scheme, CPF contributions (I am a Singaporean, and will be hiring Sinagporean), and other things I need to get up and running.

thoughts.content: To hire staff in Singapore as a sole proprietor, you'll need to follow certain procedures like registering with CPF e-Submission and setting up CPF accounts. Employers must pay CPF contributions for Singaporean employees, with due dates typically around the 14th day of the following month. Additionally, you'll need to ensure compliance with the Employment Act, handle work passes if hiring foreigners, and follow the Auto-Inclusion Scheme (AIS) for income reporting.
chunks: To hire staff in Singapore as a sole proprietor, you'll need to follow certain procedures like registering with CPF e-Submission and setting up CPF accounts.
Employers must pay CPF contributions for Singaporean employees, with due dates typically around the 14th day of the following month.
Additionally, you'll need to ensure compliance with the Employment Act, handle work passes if hiring foreigners, and follow the Auto-Inclusion Scheme (AIS) for income reporting.

thoughts.content: For hiring Singaporean employees, the payment deadlines for CPF contributions are typically due by the 14th of the following month, with late interest if not paid on time. PRs have graduated rates, while Citizens pay full CPF rates. Employers will also need to comply with the IRAS Auto-Inclusion Scheme (AIS), which requires submitting income information electronically by March 1 if they have 5 or more employees. However, I should double-check if there are updates for 2025.

thoughts.content: For admins, employers need to consider the Skills Development Levy (SDL), which is 0.25% of the first $4,500 of monthly remuneration, with a minimum of $2 and a maximum of $11.25 per employee. Foreign worker levies don’t apply to locals. Singapore doesn't have a general minimum wage but has a Progressive Wage Model (PWM) for specific sectors like cleaning, security, and food services. I need to confirm the latest wage thresholds, especially for foreign workers.

thoughts.content: The "Local Qualifying Salary" (LQS) threshold is only relevant for hiring foreign workers, so it doesn't apply to local-only hires. Still, it’s worth being aware of for compliance. There's also the "Tripartite Guidelines on Fair Employment Practices" (TG-FEP) and upcoming legislation like "COMPASS." Regarding insurance, as of 2024, non-manual workers earning up to $2,600 monthly must be covered by Work Injury Compensation Insurance. I’ll verify the latest thresholds.

thoughts.content:
To hire employees in Singapore, you'll need to complete a range of administrative tasks:
- Register with BizFile and CorpPass.
- Set up CPF submissions, Skills Development Levy (SDL), and SHG contributions.
- Ensure compliance with leave entitlements, work injury insurance, and payslip requirements.
- Verify taxable reporting requirements under AIS, especially for employee income submission and the updated IR8A form rules.

I’ll confirm the latest changes to contribution thresholds and deductions soon!

entries.title: Foxconn tells India recruiters: Nix marital status in iPhone job ads
entries.snippet: Foxconn, a major supplier for Apple, has instructed its Indian hiring agents to exclude criteria such as age, gender, and marital status from job advertisements for iPhone assembly workers, and to not mention Foxconn's name in these ads. This directive follows a Reuters investigation revealing Foxconn's previous exclusion of married women from these roles, which contradicted anti-discrimination policies of both Foxconn and Apple. Previously, Foxconn’s recruitment ads specified that only unmarried women within certain age ranges were eligible, especially contravening during high production periods. The company has now standardized its recruitment materials without discriminative criteria and benefits like free transport and hostel facilities. Despite these changes, it remains unclear if Foxconn has genuinely adopted inclusive hiring practices. Following the revelations, India's government initiated investigations into Foxconn's hiring practices, yet the outcomes of these probes have not been disclosed. Foxconn and Apple have not commented on these recent developments.

parts:
Here’s a practical, compliance-first checklist for a sole proprietorship in Singapore hiring local (Singapore Citizen / PR) staff, with the admin you must set up and what to do each pay run and at year-end. I’ve linked you to the MOM/CPF/IRAS/PDPC pages so you can verify every requirement.

---

# 0) One-time setup (before you issue an offer)

**A. CorpPass access to the right government services**
- Make sure you (or your payroll preparer) have CorpPass roles for:
  - **CPF EZPay** (to file and pay CPF/SDL/SHG each month). You’ll need to assign the “CPF EZPay” e-Service to authorised users. citeturn2search10turn6search1  
  - **IRAS “Submit Employment Income Records”** (for the Auto-Inclusion Scheme submissions). IRAS has an approver/preparer authorisation guide. citeturn6search8

**B. CPF employer registration**
- **Apply for a CPF Submission Number (CSN)** — you can’t submit CPF without it. citeturn2search0turn2search5  
- **Set up payment** in CPF EZPay (Direct Debit / PayNow QR). Direct Debit (eGIRO) is the easiest way to avoid late interest. citeturn6search12turn6search15

**C. Employment documentation and payroll controls**
- **Issue written Key Employment Terms (KETs)** within 14 days of start (earlier is better). MOM lists the fields that must be in KETs (role, hours, pay period, OT basis, leave, etc.). citeturn1search5turn1search0  
- **Itemised payslips** are compulsory; MOM lists the 12 items to include (basic pay, period, allowances, deductions incl. CPF, OT hours and OT pay, net pay). Keep payslip records **2 years** for current staff and **1 year after** for ex-staff. citeturn7view1  
- **Maintain employment & salary records** to MOM’s standard (same retention rule as payslips). citeturn0search0  
- **Work injury insurance (WIC)** is **mandatory** for **all manual workers** and for **non-manual workers earning ≤ S$2,600/month**. Buy before they start. citeturn0search5  
- **PDPA / Data Protection**: appoint a **Data Protection Officer (DPO)** and publish the DPO contact. citeturn1search4  
- **Flexible Work Arrangements process**: from **1 Dec 2024** you must have a basic process to receive and consider formal FWA requests (you don’t have to grant them, but you must handle requests properly). citeturn12search0  
- **Fair hiring**: follow the Tripartite Guidelines—no discriminatory criteria in job ads (age, gender, race, religion, etc.). citeturn8search0

> Note (owner’s CPF): You **cannot** pay employer CPF for yourself as a sole-prop owner (you count as self-employed). You contribute **MediSave** annually based on your **Net Trade Income** instead. citeturn4search0turn4search4

---

# 1) CPF, SDL and related statutory deductions

**A. Who needs CPF?**  
You must pay CPF for local employees (SC/PR) earning **> S$50/month**. For **S$50–S$500**, only the employer share is payable; ≥ S$500 both employer & employee shares apply. citeturn2search12

**B. Contribution rates (2025, Singapore Citizens / PRs at full rates)**  
(Employer + Employee on **Ordinary Wages** (OW) and **Additional Wages** (AW); OW monthly cap below.)

- **≤ 55**: **17% + 20%** = 37%  
- **> 55–60**: **15.5% + 17%** = 32.5%  
- **> 60–65**: **12% + 11.5%** = 23.5%  
- **> 65–70**: **9% + 7.5%** = 16.5%  
- **> 70**: **7.5% + 5%** = 12.5%  
(Official 2025 tables.) citeturn5view1

**C. Wage ceilings**  
- **OW monthly ceiling (2025)**: **S$7,400** (rises to **S$8,000** in 2026 per schedule). citeturn2search4  
- **AW annual ceiling**: **S$102,000 −** total OW subject to CPF for the year. citeturn0search8

**D. Payment deadline and interest**  
- **Due date** is **the last day of each month**.  
- MOM/CPF take **enforcement action** if not paid by **the 14th of the following month**. **Late interest 1.5%/month** accrues **from the day after the due date** (i.e., from the 1st of the next month). citeturn11search4turn11search0turn11search1

**E. Skills Development Levy (SDL)**  
Pay **SDL** together with CPF: **0.25% of monthly total wages**, **min S$2** (< S$800) and **max S$11.25** (> S$4,500). citeturn0search3turn0search15

**F. Self-Help Group (SHG) contributions**  
You’re **expected to deduct** SHG contributions (CDAC/MBMF/SINDA/ECF) based on employee profile and remit with CPF; employees may opt-out directly with the SHG. citeturn0search4

---

# 2) IRAS – Auto-Inclusion Scheme (AIS) for employment income

- **Who must join?** Employers with **≥ 5 employees** in the year must participate; below that you can still **register voluntarily**. citeturn15view2  
- **How to register**: Do it in **myTax Portal** (year-round), assign “Submit Employment Income Records” roles in CorpPass, then file each year. citeturn15view2turn6search8  
- **Filing window / due date**: Submit employment income **by 1 March** each year for the preceding calendar year. citeturn3search2  
- **What gets filed**: Include **all employees** (categories are listed by IRAS—full-time, part-time, directors, leavers with income, etc.). citeturn0search13  
- **If you’re in AIS** you **do not** issue hardcopy **IR8A/Appendix 8A/8B/IR8S** to employees (but many employers still provide a year-end statement for their records). citeturn3search0

---

# 3) Employment Act essentials to build into your HR policy

- **Salary payment timing**: Pay salary at least monthly, **within 7 days after the end of the salary period**; **OT pay within 14 days** after the end of the salary period. citeturn13search0  
- **OT eligibility & rate** (Part IV coverage): **Non-workmen ≤ S$2,600** and **workmen ≤ S$4,500** are OT-entitled; pay **≥ 1.5×** hourly basic; OT rate for non-workmen is capped at the S$2,600 salary level (S$13.60/hr). citeturn1search1turn1search6  
- **Paid sick leave**: up to **14 days outpatient + 60 days hospitalisation** (the 60 includes the 14) after 6 months’ service (pro-rated before that). citeturn1search2  
- **Annual leave**: entitled after 3 months’ service (MOM page gives the schedule and scenarios). citeturn1search3  
- **Accident reporting**: if someone is injured or gets an occupational disease from work, you must **file a WSH incident report within 10 days** (earlier notification for fatalities). citeturn16search0

---

# 4) Your monthly cycle (what to do each pay run)

1) **Run payroll** (capture basic, allowances, OT, bonuses).  
2) **Issue itemised payslips** and **pay salaries on time** (see timings above). citeturn7view1turn13search0  
3) **Compute statutory amounts** in CPF EZPay and **submit & pay**:
   - **CPF** (respect OW/AW ceilings and age-band rates). citeturn5view1  
   - **SDL** (auto-calculated in CPF EZPay). citeturn0search3  
   - **SHG** (if applicable to the employee). citeturn0search4  
4) **Pay by month-end** to avoid interest; absolute hard stop is **the 14th next month** before enforcement kicks in (but interest accrues from the 1st if you miss month-end). citeturn11search4turn11search0  
5) **Keep records** (MOM retention rules for payslips & employment records). citeturn0search0

---

# 5) Year-end (every January–March)

- **Confirm totals** (OW and AW for CPF; check you didn’t breach AW ceiling). citeturn0search8  
- **AIS submission** to IRAS **by 1 March** (use myTax Portal or payroll software integrated to IRAS). citeturn3search2  
- **If not in AIS**, you must still prepare **IR8A** (and appendices where applicable) for each relevant employee. citeturn3search0

---

# 6) Nice-to-have (but smart) at the start

- **Set Direct Debit (eGIRO) for CPF** to eliminate accidental late payment interest. citeturn6search15  
- **Buy basic group outpatient cover** (not mandatory for locals, but good risk management alongside compulsory WIC). citeturn0search5  
- **Publish DPO contact** (PDPA) and a short privacy notice for staff records. citeturn1search4

---

## Common pitfalls (avoid these)

- **Missing the real CPF due date**: the legal **due date is month-end**, and **interest (1.5%/month)** runs from **the 1st**, even though enforcement only starts after the **14th**. Don’t rely on the 14th “grace” window. citeturn11search4turn11search1  
- **Forgetting OW/AW caps**: salary above **S$7,400/month (2025)** doesn’t attract more CPF on OW; check AW against the **S$102k** annual formula. citeturn2search4turn0search8  
- **Not buying WIC** for eligible roles (manual / non-manual ≤ S$2,600). MOM enforces this. citeturn0search5  
- **Incomplete payslips / KETs** or missing record retention. MOM audits these. citeturn7view1turn0search0

---

## If you later hire foreigners (not your current plan, but for completeness)
- You’ll need to satisfy **Fair Consideration Framework** job-ad requirements and apply for the relevant pass (EP/S Pass/Work Permit). Also, **Local Qualifying Salary (LQS)** rules kick in for counting local headcount towards quotas (LQS is **S$1,600/month**; **S$10.50/hr** part-time). citeturn8search2turn14search0

---

### Quick starter order of operations (in practice)

1) CorpPass roles → **CPF EZPay** + **IRAS Submit Employment Income Records**. citeturn2search10turn6search8  
2) Apply **CSN**; set **Direct Debit**; test CPF EZPay login. citeturn2search0turn6search12  
3) Buy **WIC insurance** if roles require. citeturn0search5  
4) Prepare **KETs**, **payroll policy**, and **itemised payslip** template. citeturn1search5turn7view1  
5) Onboard employee; collect bank/NRIC/SHG status; assign DPO contact. citeturn1search4  
6) Run first payroll; **submit CPF/SDL/SHG**; pay by **month-end** (don’t miss). citeturn11search4  
7) If you’ll have **≥ 5 staff** this year, **register for AIS** now (don’t wait till tax season). citeturn15view2

If you want, I can turn this into a one-page internal SOP plus a minimal KET and payslip template aligned to MOM’s item list.
